metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11358 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description: jQuery before 3.4.0, as used in Drupal, Backdrop CMS, and other products, mishandles jQuery.extend(true, {}, ...) because of Object.prototype pollution. If an unsanitized source object contained an enumerable __proto__ property, it could extend the native Object.prototype.

criterions.comment: jquery: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
mediawiki: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
node-jquery: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
otrs2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
